channel.title: Victor S. Melo
channel.description: Recent content on Victor S. Melo

item.title: Swift Failable Initializer
item.description: Swift: Failable Initializer Consider the case below: final class Human { let name: String var age: Int init(name: String, age: Int) { self.name = name self.age = age } } This is a simple class that represents a human being. At a first glance, we may not see any problem in this definition… or do we? To understand the problems, we can play with the boundaries values. (This is a technique widely used in software testing).

item.title: Processes and Threads
item.description: In this article, I present an overview about processes and threads. Processes A process can be explained as “a program being executed“. A process is not a program. You can have n processes for the same program. For example, when you open a tab in Chrome, it creates a new process called Google Chrome Helper (Renderer). So, Google Chrome can have multiple processes. In the image above, I have multiple Chrome processes.

item.title: Hello, World!
item.description: Hello! My name is Victor and I’m an iOS consultant at ThoughtWorks, and a computer science undergraduate student at Federal University of Rio Grande do Sul, Brazil. I’ve been using a personal website since 2017, but it was more like a “web business card”, showing my projects, social media, and so on. Now I want to use this space to share content. The topics will be about anything I find interesting in my “computer scientist world”, that includes software engineering topics I learn in my daily work at ThoughtWorks, content I found interesting in my college classes, Apple platform development, and other related stuffs.
